qas.question: Who did the Yongle Emperor send to Tibet?

answers.text: Hou Xian and the Buddhist monk Zhi Guang

qas.question: Why did the Yongle Emperor send Hou Xian and Zhi Guang to Tibet?
When did Hou Xian and Zhi Guang return to Nanjing?
Where did Hou Xian and Zhi Guang travel through on their way to the Karmapa?

answers.text: through Qinghai or via the Silk Road to Khotan

context: In order <a1_0>to seek out the Karmapa<a1_0/>, the Yongle Emperor dispatched his eunuch <a0_0>Hou Xian and the Buddhist monk Zhi Guang<a0_0/> (d. 1435) to Tibet. Traveling to Lhasa either <a3_0>through Qinghai or via the Silk Road to Khotan<a3_0/>, Hou Xian and Zhi Guang did not return to Nanjing until <a2_0>1407<a2_0/>.
